org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction

Class CommunicationGateway

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.universAAL.lddi.abstraction.CommunicationGateway

  • public abstract class CommunicationGateway
extends Object
    A gateway providing a bridge to a network of external components making it for component integrators possible to gain access to related external datapoints. For a better understanding, please refer to both the package documentation and the documentation of the methods further below.

      • getConfigAppID

        public String getConfigAppID()

      • addDiscoverer

        protected final void addDiscoverer(ExternalComponentDiscoverer d)
        Only subclasses can introduce discoverers, which just serves as a sort of "registered certificate". Calling "component discovery methods" (addComponents, removeComponents, replaceComponents and updateComponents) is only possible, if such a previously "registered certificate" is passed to those methods.
        Parameters:
        d -

      • getSubscribedDatapoint

        protected final ExternalDatapoint getSubscribedDatapoint(String address)

      • getValue

        protected abstract Object getValue(String pullAddress)
        Subclasses must make sure to read the value of the external data-point at the given pullAddress and convert it from the original externalType to the target internalType before returning the value object.
        Parameters:
        pullAddress -
        externalType -
        internalType -
        Returns:

      • init

        public final void init(org.universAAL.middleware.container.ModuleContext mc,
                       Object[] cgwSharingParams,
                       org.universAAL.middleware.managers.api.ConfigurationManager confMgr,
                       org.universAAL.middleware.managers.api.ConfigurationEditor confEditor,
                       boolean needsEventingSimulation)
        Parameters:
        mc - The module context of your communication gateway.
        cgwSharingParams - This is needed for sharing your communication gateway within the current container so that component integrators can find it. If your communication gateway runs on top of OSGi, the value to pass here should be "new Object[] {CommunicationGateway.class.getName()}".
        confMgr - If not null, it means that you want to use the standard configuration mechanism implemented by this abstract framework. In your code under OSGi, you can get the confMgr by "(ConfigurationManager) mc.getContainer().fetchSharedObject(mc, new Object[] { ConfigurationManager.class.getName() })", where "mc" is assumed to be your ModuleContext.
        Note:The interface "ConfigurationManager" has been defined by the artifact "mw.managers.api.core" from the "org.universAAL.middleware" group.

      • notifySubscribers

        protected final void notifySubscribers(String address,
                                       Object value)
        Subclasses should call this method in order to pass an external event to universAAL environment. The value is expected to be of a type defined in the underlying ontological model; this is why the expected target type is passed to the subclass as the last parameter in #subscribe(String, Object, MergedRestriction). However, if the subclass does not need an own management of individual subscriptions and hence has an empty implementation of #subscribe(String, Object, MergedRestriction) without memorizing the type info, it my use getSubscribedDatapoint(String) and then fetch the type info by calling ExternalDatapoint#getExternalValueType() andExternalDatapoint#getInternalValueType().
        Parameters:
        address -
        value -

      • removeComponents

        public void removeComponents(List<ExternalComponent> components,
                             ExternalComponentDiscoverer discoverer)

        public void replaceComponents(List<ExternalComponent> components,
                              ExternalComponentDiscoverer discoverer)

      • setValue

        protected abstract void setValue(String setAddress,
                                 Object value)
        Subclasses must make sure to convert the passed input value from the original internalType to the target externalType before sending the value to the external system under setAddress.
        Parameters:
        setAddress -
        value -
        externalType -
        internalType -

      • subscribe

        protected abstract void subscribe(String pushAddress)
        If the subclass subscribes anyhow for all datapoints, then the implementation of this method can be just empty!
        Parameters:
        pushAddress -
        externalType - Values linked with the given pushAddress and passed in the original related events from the external system are expected to be of this type.
        internalType - Values linked with the given pushAddress and to be passed when calling notifySubscribers(String, Object) have to be of this type.

      • updateComponents

        public void updateComponents(List<ExternalComponent> components,
                             ExternalComponentDiscoverer discoverer)
